page.title: 07FISHING
page.content: The name of the fishing club I belong to is called The Evesham and District Fishing Club. We meet every Monday night between half past five and six o'clock when the draw is made and we start fishing at half past six. Sometimes the match is called off because the river is too high. I somtimes go to Twyford Farm area to practise for the National Team. We fish for Chubb, Dace, Roach or Bream or even Minnows. The bait we use is mostly maggots, ground bait, castors and hemp. Children my age pay 50p and we have a contest. We weigh all the fish that we catch and if we win we get some money, but you have to wait until the end of the year when there is a presentation. We have to buy a licence to be able to fish and this costs us 2.
